education.blurb: PhD in Electrical Engineering at the Laboratory for the Recognition and Organization of Speech and Audio, advisor Dan Ellis, 4.1 cumulative GPA
Master of Arts in Music, Science, and Technology at the Center for Computer Research in Music and Acoustics, 4.1 cumulative GPA
Bachelor of Arts in Mathematics with Physics minor and independent studies in audio circuit design, 3.7 cumulative GPA

Advanced Machine Learning, Statistical Machine Learning, Introduction to Adaptive Signal Representations, Sparse Representations and High-Dimensional Geometry, Speech Recognition, Signal Processing Methods in Musical Acoustics, Audio Applications of the Fast Fourier Transform
